text: Hi guys, I’m quite new to HubSpot and I’m about to create a landing page dnd template, but I have a problem setting the width and offset of columns and modules. All the modules turn out 12 columns, even though I set the width and offset to something else. I don’t think it’s a CSS issue because the modules don’t even get the correct CSS class. Even if I set `width=7`, the CSS class I see when I inspect is `span12`. Offset is ignored completely. I have the feeling I’ve missed something really simple, but I can’t figure out what. Any tips much welcome :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello guys, I am very new in HubSpot and need help
I need to add editable (not rich text) tag into my template inside dnd_module tag . Is it possible? Unfortunatly i can`t see any updates even with simple div tag. Template stay the same(

everything you add on this position is part of the RichText Field. If you want to add something else the module ( for example a text or image) , you would need to add it outside of the  rich Text field
Found the reason – I had been updating the content in the content editor, so my code changes didn’t reflect on the page since content changes override the template
